title: U.S. college students average study hours , by major 2011
yAxis: Number of hours spent studying per week
summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Number of hours spent studying per week in the y axis.
Month Architecture has the highest Number of hours spent studying per week and Speech has the lowest Number of hours spent studying per week.
The highest value at Month Architecture is 2.19x times more than the lowest value at Speech.
min_summary: This bar chart has 29 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Number of hours spent studying per week in each Month on the y axis.
The Number of hours spent studying per week is appeared to be the highest at Month Architecture and lowest at Month Speech.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Number of hours spent studying per week in the y axis.
Month Architecture has the highest Number of hours spent studying per week and Speech has the lowest Number of hours spent studying per week.
The highest value at Month Architecture is 2.19x times more than the lowest value at Speech.
max_summary: This bar chart has 29 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Number of hours spent studying per week in each Month on the y axis.
The maximum Number of hours spent studying per week 23.7 is found at Month Architecture and the minimum is found at Speech where Number of hours spent studying per week is 10.8.
The lowest value at Month Speech is 2.19x times less than the highest value at Architecture.
Month Architecture is higher than any other Months with value 23.7, followed by , and Physics. Down to Month Speech with the lowest value 10.8.
Over the past 29 Months, the Number of hours spent studying per week has decreased.
Month Theater, and Anthropology share the same value 16.0.
The Month Speech tends to be 1.53 percent lower than average.
The Number of hours spent studying per week is 448.5 if we add up values of all Months.
